thread.title: LeEco Le Pro 3 first impressions: a lion in sheep's clothing [VIDEO]
thread.title_full: LeEco Le Pro 3 first impressions: a lion in sheep's clothing [VIDEO]

title: LeEco Le Pro 3 first impressions: a lion in sheep's clothing [VIDEO]
text:
LeEco Le Pro 3 first impressions: a lion in sheep’s clothing LeEco Le Pro 3 first impressions: a lion in sheep’s clothing [VIDEO] By - March 8, 2017 “The Le Pro 3 boasts a Snapdragon 821 processor and retails for the same amount as the OnePlus 3T” 
To say that Chinese smartphone manufacturer LeEco is in hot waters would be an understatement. The company recently fired over 85 percent of its staff working in India, but denied any plans to exit the country. It will be interesting to see the product roadmap of LeEco for India in the upcoming months and whether its flagship offering in the form of Le Pro 3 is a part of it. While all of that is up for debate, we managed to get our hands on the flagship at Qualcomm’s booth at MWC and here’s a quick first look for you guys.The LeEco Le Pro 3 is without a doubt, one of the best flagship killers we’ve seen in 2017 so far, and has all the right ingredients to make it an instant success. Be it the metal build, or the top-end Snapdragon 821 processor aided by 6GB of RAM, the LeEco Pro 3 exudes premium and for the asking price of 2,999 Yuan (~Rs 30,100) for the top-end variant, it will definitely give the OnePlus 3T ( review ) a run for its money. If only the device comes to India… Facebook Comments
